data.title: Wonderful atmosphere, challenging food
data.text: The decor of the Union is unique and elegant. The menu was very original and needed considerable interpretation. The 4 of us shared a scrumptious starter of crispy brussels sprouts and a cauliflower salad.  Three of us had the short rib dish and one had the cod.  All items were prepared with a unique presentation. We all found the beef to be a little fatty.  We really enjoyed sharing the dessert selection of small pastries & chocolates.  Service was courteous but on the slow side.

data.title: Chefs tasting menu
data.text:
Have eaten at the Union restaurant several times. Ambience, service, food and drink are excellent. Have ordered the five course Chef's tasting dinner with wine pairing twice. Honestly, those meals have been the best meals I have ever had. I'm a foodie. I travel the world and the Union restaurant Chef tasting menu with wine pairing is second to none. Every course is amazing with perfect wine.  Each time the dishes were different but lobster and Wagu beef were included. We would laugh after a bite of the food because it was so crazy delicious. This perfection comes at a cost though. Our meal for three with tip came to $450. Not cheap but memorable and worth it. 
Union compares with Eventide which is my other favorite Portland restaurant. Enjoy!

owner_response.author: Derek H, Manager at Union, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Lindseydvm,
In a town full of great food we are honored to read you find Union to be "second to none" and your dining experiences to be "the best meals I have ever had". The entire team here at Union takes an enormous amount of pride in providing each guest with a memorable experience! We will be looking forward to welcoming you back where I promise you will have another great meal! 

Derek

data.title: Unexpected!
data.text:

I strongly recommend the cod. It is great. It is delicated grilled and served on a bed of vegetables, -fennel, cabagge, mushrooms-.
I also take an arrugula salad with pecorino cheese that was excellent to. The quality of the service is very remarkable. The good humor, the kind disposition, the way they treat us make enjoy a very pleasant experience.
It is, for far, more than "the hotel restaurant's".

data.title: Pawn the kids, sell the car...
data.text: Do what you have to do get to Union before they realise how good they are. Contemporary settings, sharp, intelligent service backed with wit and knowledge. An entrée of local flash fried octopus on red cabbage: outstanding.  The red cabbage salad was the best I've ever eaten. Turns out the main course (oricchiette, scallops, local clams, smoked ham...) was even better: beautifully cooked and presented with every flavour in concert.  And without the American obsession for scale, this was a supremely satisfying meal.  OK, the dessert was not to the same standard, but how could they actually achieve that outcome?  So I say, pawn the kids...get there now, even if you don't bother with anything else in Portland - eat at Union.

data.title: Outstanding dining experience
data.text: One of the newer dining venues in the city, Union is located in the recently opened Press Hotel.  The space is full of natural light and modern furnishings which look on to the busy city street. The menu is full of creative offerings which make decisions difficult.  We started with the fried octopus served with shoshito peppers.  It was absolutely delicious.  Following that the salmon course was a more than generous portion perfectly cooked and accompanied by shiitake mushrooms.  Equally as outstanding were the seared scallops, fresh and succulent.  The chocolate semifreddo dessert was a show stopper.  The wine list was reasonably priced and offered some interesting varietals.  Service is very attentive, but not fussy. Stop and have a drink before dinner in the lobby  bar.  The hotel decor pays homage to the original use of the building which was the space occupied by the Portland Press Herald.  In a city full of superb dining choices, Union stands out as a winner.

owner_response.author: Derek H, Manager at Union, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
circe64,

Speaking for the entire team here at Union thank you for taking the time to share such kind words. I am admittedly biased but I couldn't agree with you more about how good the octopus, salmon, scallops, and chocolate semifreddo dishes were! They were certainly some of my favorites from the summer menu.  We just recently released our new fall menu so please come back soon and try the new dishes. I promise you won't be disappointed! 

Derek

data.title: Poor Five-Course Tasting (Please, No More Mushrooms...)
data.text:
My wife and I came here and tried the five course tasting menu, hoping for something somewhat special.  Literally four of the five courses, with the fifth being dessert, had mushrooms as their primary ingredient (three of those four mushroom courses had oyster mushrooms).

I love mushrooms. I really do.  But I don't want to eat mushrooms for every meal of my prix fixe meal.  After dish two my wife and I were joking to ourselves and asking each other if the third course would contain mushrooms- and surprise, it did.  By the time the fourth course came, the comedic effect wore off.  

When you pay $250+ for two people for a tasting menu, at least try to be creative.  I've never seen a restaurant so brazenly offer literally the same main ingredient in every savory prix fixe dish.  If this restaurant were inexpensive, I suppose I wouldn't care too much, but this place wasn't cheap at all.  

With that said, the ambience and service were great.  Our waitress was efficient and friendly.  And the wine pairing with our fairly terrible five-course tasting was actually good in that the pours were hearty.  All the more reason why it's a shame the food was such a major letdown.

owner_response.author: Derek H, Manager at Union, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dimitrios D,

I would like to thank you for spending part of your holiday weekend with us here at Union and for taking the time to provide us with valuable feedback. I am thrilled to read that you found both the atmosphere and service to be "great". In regards to the tasting menu I feel as though I owe you and our culinary team an apology. The tasting menu for the evening was in fact a "mushroom tasting" and was to be presented to our guests as such. I am disappointed that we did not adequately present or describe the evenings tasting menu. I truly hope you will decide to dine with us again soon as I am confident you will thoroughly enjoy your entire experience!

Derek

data.title: Food with a uniqueness of it's own!
data.text:
We found the food at the Union restaurant to be comparable to all of our “foodie” experiences in Portland with a special uniqueness of its own.  
Dinners offered "farm to table" freshness and a creativity of flavor combinations and presentations that surpassed many of my dining experiences.  The Union Bar was set up to offer a variety of local beers on tap and there were a variety of specialty cocktails offered, Erik created a special one just for me.  Creativity in the kitchen and at the bar; couldn't get much better than that!  For breakfast I chose eggs benedict; the eggs were poached to a perfect medium and the hollandaise sauce was light and the best tasting I've ever had.  The cappuccino was served with a nice design swirl.  The Union restaurant is at the top of our list of "foodie" experiences in Portland.
